#summary How data flows around the system

Data is ingested into Fedora using SWORD, edited using XForms, manipulated and cross-walked using XSLT transformations, and exported to an OAI-PMH server and a search engine.

The automated flow of data through the system is driven by a set of events:

=Events=

<table>
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Event name</th>
<th>Description</th>
<th>Responses triggered by event</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Ingest</td>
<td>Ingestion of package of data and initial metadata from booking system.</td>
<td>
<ul>
<li>mint and attach PID</li>
<li>extract technical metadata</li>
<li>convert booking system metadata to editable form</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Extraction</td>
<td>Automated extraction of technical metadata from data files</td>
<td>Update the Solr index and OAI-PMH provider of RIF-CS.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Metadata Entry</td>
<td>Manual entry of metadata using a form</td>
<td>Update the Solr index and OAI-PMH provider of RIF-CS.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Data Upload</td>
<td>Manual upload of new data files to an existing record.</td>
<td>Extract technical metadata</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
